website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus M.Zuiko Lens 12mm f2.0 is a wide Micro Four Thirds lens. It's incredibly sharp, but shows some color fringing and is on the pricey side.

customer_reviews.title: great standard wide
customer_reviews.text: My favorite standard wide for m43. Very sharp, colors look great, no image distortion at corners, great build quality (lightweight, but sturdy). The sliding focus ring doesn't work great for video, seems to be a delay in the electronic focusing mechanism. Overall I love this lens and haven't found any better 12mm on mft. Have tried a manual exposure 12mm (slr magic), but wasn't quit happy with the sharpness or the flaring, but it's the only lens that comes close to the Oly.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Prefect lens
customer_reviews.text: Delivery i service very good. LENS - Low distorsion and high resolution = very good lens.
customer_reviews.author: Janusz Cetlin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite lens
customer_reviews.text: I use this in a trio with the Panasonic 20mm and the Olympus 45mm. It is far away my favorite lens (admittedly, it should be at this price!). I find it renders with just the right amount of character, and it's a perfect 24mm equivalent. It also looks great with the optional metal lens cap, making the entire camera look like a work of art.
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Equivalent to a 24mm on 35mm film camera
customer_reviews.text: Fast glass in a prime lens. One of the best wide angles for micro 4/3 cameras. Better images than most zooms can deliver at this size. Does not come new with lens hood, which helps prevent flare under certain lighting conditions. Worthy though pricey lens for the enthusiast or pro. A keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Lau

customer_reviews.title: Very good for landscapes and interiors
customer_reviews.text: I've used it to take pictures in some events with several opportunities along with my 75mm 1.8 and this lens provides excellent results not only in landscapes, its natural usage, but also in close group people pictures taken at short distance. For a better end result I also use a perspective correction software (DxO) that makes very good corrections in the geometric distortion of elements located in the perimeter of the picture. It's probably one of the best wide angle lens you can get today in m4/3, giving close to professional results.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Seller delivered as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera and it works perfectly. Seller delivered as promised and in almost perfect condition as stated.
customer_reviews.author: David Thiessen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent optic for drone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality optic for my DJI Inspire 1 drone with X5 and X5R gimbal/cameras
customer_reviews.author: Chris Crumley

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest M4/3 Lens I Own
customer_reviews.text: After using this lens for a couple of weeks on my GF3 and GH2, I can say the sharpness is amazing. At least equal to, if not better then the pany 20mm Prime. Be aware that there is some minor vignetting (darkening of corners) when used wide open at F2.0. This is not uncommon in a lot of lenses. Close down your aperture a bit to get rid of this. I usually try and shoot around F6.3 to reach my own personal sweet spot for this lens. I rarely need/desire the shallow depth of field you get at F2.0.
customer_reviews.author: terryoregon

customer_reviews.title: Others have said it better
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens so much more than I thought I would. I've found it to be a very useful focal length and its quality is very high. The photos it renders are very pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Felter

customer_reviews.title: a beautiful lens
customer_reviews.text: fast, silent, and sharp with fantastic build quality. a gem of lens that takes amazing pictures. Use it as my main lens on the OM-D.
customer_reviews.author: zolo

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens For A Wide Shot !
customer_reviews.text: This lens is quite pricy but it gives an excellent wide shot without going to a fish eye or ultra wide angle. It has the Manual Focus ring which is excellent for on the fly manual focus. I did get the discount but it is still a bit pricy but if you want a nice wide angle shot this is the one to get and it is worth it. It gives you a much wider and better shot than the Lumix 14 mm. I would recommend this to a friend that like to take a wide shot.
customer_reviews.author: Alloveramp

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and expected!
customer_reviews.text: All likes, no disappointments. Sharpness, colour and focusing essentially instantaneous. Very, very good lens. An excellent choice for OMD-5. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Tony H.

customer_reviews.title: Great on DJI Inspire X5 X5s cameras
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for use on a DJI Inspire2/ x5s for wider angle. Great build and saturation... Pro Grade.
customer_reviews.author: xoperator

customer_reviews.title: Superb lens
customer_reviews.text: I've been incredibly pleased with this lens. Using it on my Olympus OM-D EM-5. It's been much more versatile than I had envisioned, and I find myself leaving this on the camera most of the time. The AF is fast, and the image quality has been superb. For the time being, I don't feel the need for a wider lens, because the 12mm is usually enough and I'm not aware of better image quality in the wider lenses currently available for the 4/3 platform.
customer_reviews.author: Ventiphoto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Very sharp. Very fast focus. Incredibly contrasty. Looks and feels awesome. Premium product.
customer_reviews.author: MatsudaMan

customer_reviews.title: Best wide for m4/3
customer_reviews.text: The best wide lens for Micro 4/3. Tried them all, this is it ( if you don't mind the 24mm FOV). If they made a 28mm equivalent this good I would buy it in a second.
customer_reviews.author: anastigmat

customer_reviews.title: Item as described and showed up in time!
customer_reviews.text: As described. I should have looked closer because there is no front lens cap. Packaging seemed light but lens made it intact on time.
customer_reviews.author: Laurent H.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for OMD EM5
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wide angle lens for the m4/3 system. It is very sharp and does very well in low light at f2.0. This lens is great for landscape photography and it allows you to get up close to your subjects. It is much smaller than my Nikon wides angle lenses, and i doubt the Nikon will see much use in the future. The only downsides to the lens are the cost and the lack of a hood.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Seale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Lens with Pen E-P3. Sharp from edge to edge; distortion easily correctable in PhotoShop. High quality finish; looks like a pro lens and performs that way. 2.0 is usable without flash in relatively dark interiors [1250 iso]. A shame that a case and lens hood are not included.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Fe Shopper

customer_reviews.title: nice lens
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp lens, incredibly useful focal length, small, light. Compared to the Panasonic 14mm 2.5 I've found it much better -- I really like the 2/3rds extra stop of light, makes a bit difference in indoor shooting quality. Still, costs much more than the Panasonic too.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Super expensive but this lens is really fabulous. Well made, looks good, great sharpness, and of course super fast. Weighs less than I would have expected. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: New Lens for PEN line
customer_reviews.text: I've taken about 300 photos with this lens and have gotten some really great shots that people have really commented on. I'm kind of new to this level of photography equipment so the only down side to this lens seems to me to be the price. The construction is first rate and looks good on the E-P3 black body. The ability to go to manual focus by pulling back the ring is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens.  Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. Definitely worth the price. The only other prime lens for my Oly that's this good is the Panasonic 20mm (which, if you're only getting one, I'd say get the Panny since it's cheaper).
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Olympus 12mm makes me smile
customer_reviews.text: I like this lens now ... even more than when I first got it. Great lens, very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Rory Blake

customer_reviews.title: Super lens, sharp, easy switch to MF, tiny
customer_reviews.text: Super lens, sharp. A bit of barrel distortion but is processed out with JPEG images. Olympus M. Zuiko Digital ED 12mm f/2.0 Lens for Micro Four Thirds Cameras
customer_reviews.author: Ella Fynoe

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got this lens -- right out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this lens -- right out of the box I used it on a doco shoot in low light and was extremely pleased with the results. It had good speed and great rendition. I bought it for my Inspire/X5R, but it has quickly become my go-to lens for other uses as well. Very glads I have this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful wide angle lens very fast aperture very good pictures same angle of view as my old 24mm on my 35mm camera. I just need to use it a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: A Gottschald

customer_reviews.title: We need more lenses like this
customer_reviews.text: A rugged all-metal lens (a rarity in m4/3) that is sharp wide open, even at the edges. Expensive, yes, but the best out there in its focal length. I'm a fan of wide-angle lenses, and this is the lens that I usually have mounted on my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Odyssey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite everyday lens. The switch from manual to auto mode on the lens is great.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal local

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic 14mm as good for 1/3 the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been comparing the Panasonic 14mm 2.5 with the Olympus 12mm and I find the results of the 14mm the same. A professional reviewer (slrgear) agrees that in the center they are as sharp. Corners are better on the 12mm in that review. But the Panasonic is a third the price.
customer_reviews.author: mgauss

customer_reviews.title: Great travel lens
customer_reviews.text: My favorite lens for travel. Small and produces stellar results for landscapes and buildings. Works well for interior shots in limited spaces. I carry two ep5 camera bodies; one with the 12mm the other with the 17mm f1.8 lens. This combination covers most travel Needs and provides a backup camera body. I have the first edition 12mm that was made in Japan.
customer_reviews.author: Carol38

customer_reviews.title: Great for Event Video
customer_reviews.text: And in general of course. [...] [...] Here's a recent video I made with it on a glidecam (steadicam device). Beautiful and sharp imagery, handles flare VERY WELL, and most importantly, for video, WAS VERY RESPONSIVE on a GH2 and almost telepathic - can't even remember adjusting the focus manually on a glidecam, with only minor hiccups for backlit subjects. DEFINITELY recommend this for videographers and I've tried the 24mm 1.4 on a Canon (similar focal length with 2x crop factor on m4/3). I prefer the Olympus 12mm - just looks WAY sharper to me and the continuous auto focus feature is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyCat

customer_reviews.title: Took a while to realize how good it is
customer_reviews.text: This lens is sharp, light, small and fast. Although it is only marginally sharper than the Olympus 12-35f2.8, it is significantly smaller. The more I use it, the better it gets (in my assessment). It's slightly narrower than the FF 24mm for some reason. The aperture isn't 1.4 or 1.7 but 2.0 is more than enough at night with the EM5 (image stabilization). It can also serve as "macro" lens without much distortion at very close distance. Construction is very solid. It's now the default lens on my EM5. Biggest negative is, price is very high given how small this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: NCHammer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiny 24mm f:2 equivalent lens!
customer_reviews.text: I've got giant Canon and Hassie H series lenses (and boat anchor bodies) and this along with the OMD EM-5 is by far my favorite little shooter. Has been for nearly a year. Looks like a toy and performs like a mini DSLR. (Which it is). Great image stabilization and fit and sharpness/IQ. Bokeh? Dunno! I'm just a pro. And don't give a rip about DP Review discussions.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F.

customer_reviews.title: Be aware!! Olympus is not a serious company!!
customer_reviews.text: Two years ago Olympus released a black "special edition" of this 12mm lens. This "special edition" was supposed to be part of a "limited" production thus, Olympus asked to pay a higher price for the black lens and I paid this premium price thinking I was making a wise investment. Well, two years later Olympus releases the same black lens for a lower price. Very disappointing!! I thought Olympus was a serious company who would take seriously customer satisfaction. Now I have realized that I was wrong and Olympus has lost my loyalty to their products and their systems. I will never invest in Olympus equipment again!!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

product_meta.title: Olympus M. Zuiko Digital ED 12mm f/2.0 Lens for Micro 4/3 Cameras (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:SilverThis high-speed, single-focal-length, wide-angle lens is ideal for shooting high-quality, dramatic landscapes and street scenes in low-light conditions. It has a beautiful full-metal body and a snap ring that enables photographers to pan focus with a distance indicator. The Movie-Still-Compatible (MSC) mechanism utilizes nearly ''silent'' focusing technology. It is great for tracking a moving child or pet, and provides a quick and silent focus mechanism for movies and still photography.

This product meets the large package requirement per UPS/FedEx. The estimated shipping cost will include this fee.
feature_bullets: Maximum f/2.0 aperture, great for low-light shooting
24mm equivalent field of view great for street shots or landscapes, Lens not zoomable
Snap focus ring with distance scale for manual focusing
Special all metal lens hood and cap optionally available
